definition: common sense/the way people usually feel about things
human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural

sentences.english: If we have abnormalities in practice, we will be amended .
sentences.chinese: 如果我們在作法上有異常情況，我們將會修正。

sentences.english: This means you have to do some handling of exceptional cases.
sentences.chinese: 這就意味着您必須對異常情況進行處理。

sentences.english: An unhandled exception occurred during index analysis.
sentences.chinese: 索引分析時發生未處理的異常情況。

sentences.english: These unusual instances will be limited to a segment of the demand curve.
sentences.chinese: 這些反常情況僅限於在需求曲線的某一部分上。

sentences.english: It's natural to see home as a safe place.
sentences.chinese: 將家庭看作一個安全的地方合乎常情。

sentences.english: If you run into this exception, you can gather the counts for this.
sentences.chinese: 如果遇到這種異常情況，可以爲此收集計數。

sentences.english: She has got such an artificial mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭腦真奇怪到了不合常情的地步。

sentences.english: Reports to Executive Housekeeper any irregularities observed on the partof the guests.
sentences.chinese: 向行政管家彙報任何在顧客部分的異常情況。

sentences.english: They report on their findings, including diseases and other abnormalities.
sentences.chinese: 他們要對自己的發現做報告，包括疾病等反常情況。

sentences.english: A related worry is that of perverse incentives.
sentences.chinese: 另一個疑慮是有悖於常情的誘因。

sentences.english: To err is human. To forgive, divine.
The following describes how to handle each kind of exception that may occur.
sentences.chinese: 下面描述瞭如何處理每種可能發生的異常情況。

sentences.english: In an ordinary way I should refuse but on this occasion I shall agree.
sentences.chinese: 若按常情我應拒絕，但在此特殊情形下我將同意。

sentences.english: Nothing is more human than fearing the outsider.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比害怕侵略者更是人之常情了。

sentences.english: To lose is human, to win is divine, to draw is an art.
sentences.chinese: 輸是人之常情，贏是神的境界，逼和是藝術。

sentences.english: An arc is a part of the circumference of a circle or other curved lines.
sentences.chinese: 這些反常情況僅限於在需求曲線的某一部分上。

definition: human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
human nature/humanity/human/the totality of human attributes
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
